subject: Re: [junit] Testing a plugin manager
msgSnippet: Several options are available based on what your testing environment supports: 1) set up some directories by hand with known contents 2) do #1, but tar/zip
messageBody:
Several options are available based on what your testing environment
supports:
1) set up some directories by hand with known contents
2) do #1, but tar/zip them and unpack them just prior to the test,
remove them afterwrds
3) create a directory structure programmatically

2 is probably the best option, b/c your test data is fixed and
established fresh for each run of the test), but is best suited to an
environment that supports some level of scripting.

T

On Wednesday, April 24, 2002, at 11:50 AM, Josh Knowles wrote:

> I have a PluginManager class which takes in a directory name and goes
> out and scans the directory, finds all jars, and loads them into the
> system. Any suggestions as to the best way to test this, currently I
> had to create a temp directory with an actual jar in it but there has to
> be a better way to do it.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Josh
